page.title: 02Wendlebury Church
page.content: The Anglican Church of St.Giles, Wendlebury is part of a united benefice with Great Chesterton and Middleton Stoney. Wendlebury population is 381 and the average congregation is 15-20 at each service. The monthly service pattern is:- 2 Evensongs (1662 Prayer Book) 1 Parish Communion (Rite B) 1 Family Service Sunday School twice a month,everage 12 children. Methodists,Baptist and Roman Catholic worshippers attend churches in Bicester. Due to increased mobility of population it is difficult to retain a regular congregation in the village church. It was built 1350,partly fell down in 1761 and was rebuilt using local labour The tower fell down in 1902 but was not rebuilt.
